summary: A taxpayer petitions for the correction of a real estate excise tax (REET) assessment claiming that the change in ownership in a limited liability company (LLC), which resulted from the extinguishment of a fifty percent owner’s membership interest under the terms of the LLC agreement due to the member’s insolvency, did not constitute a “transfer” or “acquisition” of a controlling interest in the LLC and that a REET-taxable transaction did not take place. Taxpayer’s petition is denied.
